definition: greedy
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied

sentences.english: So to not to greedy butterfly, only small bees busy all day.
sentences.chinese: 所以招引不来贪心的蝴蝶，只有小蜜蜂整日的忙碌着。

sentences.english: The greedy ones even hang up a pillow-case④ or a sack⑤ to try to get more presents.
sentences.chinese: 一些贪心的会挂枕垫或大袋，来拿更多的礼物。

sentences.english: Greedy and dissatisfied person who like a snake tries to swallow an elephant.
sentences.chinese: 帮帮我啊贪心不足蛇吞象翻译英语是什么？

sentences.english: Forsake your greed, abandon your appetites of ostentation.
sentences.chinese: 除去你的贪心，放弃你所炫耀的爱好。

sentences.english: Greedy algorithm is a simple approximative method in graph coloring.
sentences.chinese: 贪心算法用于图的染色问题是一种简单的近似方法。

sentences.english: The eyes of the merchant were full of cupidity.
sentences.chinese: 那个商人的眼里满是贪心。

sentences.english: Chen Kun continued that "you are also originally a greedy woman."
sentences.chinese: 陈坤接话说，“原来你也是个贪心的女人。”
莎士比亚说“时间是贪心的。”

sentences.english: Greed will bury even the lucky eventually.
sentences.chinese: 贪心甚至最终将埋葬好运。

sentences.english: Don't let those grasping taxi drivers overcharge you.
sentences.chinese: 别让那些贪心的计程车司机多收你的钱。

sentences.english: You are a crook like everyone in town thinks you are. You're greedy.
sentences.chinese: 就像镇上每个人说的那样，你言而无信，还贪心。

sentences.english: Was he greedy, or gullible, or stubbornly blind to the truth?
sentences.chinese: 还是他贪心，过于轻信或者顽固地对事实视而不见？

sentences.english: Improve a greedy algorithm for discretization of continuous attribute.
sentences.chinese: 改进了连续属性离散化的贪心算法。

sentences.english: The tiger has once tasted blood is never sated with the taste of it.
sentences.chinese: 老虎一次尝到血，它的贪心就更大。

definition: avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
avaricious and insatiable (idiom); greedy and never satisfied
greed/avarice/rapacious/avid
to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt
avaricious/greedy/rapacious/insatiable/avid
to be greedy in getting money
a man who is never content is like a snake trying to swallow an elephant (idiom)
pinyin: ren2 xin1 bu4 zu2 she2 tun1 xiang4

definition: bottomless pit of desire (idiom); insatiable greed/carnal cravings are never satisfied and are a main obstruction on the path to enlightenment
mad about money (idiom)
to covet/to seek (riches, fame)
to cling to/to be reluctant to give up (sth)/to have a fondness for (an indulgence etc)
greedy for sex/given to lust for women
to reap without sowing (idiom)
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
so pleased as to lose one's sense of measure/beside oneself with joy
gluttonous/voracious
